answers.answer: Other developers are only able to view the code in your repository.
Other developers will be able to edit the code in your repository.
Other developers can fork a copy of your repository that doesn't affect the original repo.
Other developers will not be able to view the code in your repository.
Only you will be able to make edits to the code in your repository.

source.guidance:
When you create a **public repository**:
- Only you will be able to make edits to the code in your repository.
- Other developers are only able to view the code in your repository.
- Other developers can fork a copy of your repository that doesn't affect the original repo.
source.instructions:
### Which of the following accurately describes a ++public repository++ on GitHub? **

Click the button below to submit

** **Hint:**There may be more than one correct answer! ---
source.name: Version Control & GitHub: Creating a GitHub Repository
